org.jetel.component.normalize

Class DataRecordNormalize

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.component.AbstractDataTransform
      • org.jetel.component.normalize.DataRecordNormalize
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RecordNormalize, Transform

    public abstract class DataRecordNormalize
extends AbstractDataTransform
implements RecordNormalize
    Base class for various normalization implementations.
    Since:
    11/21/06
    See Also:
    Denormalizer

      • init

        public boolean init(java.util.Properties parameters,
           DataRecordMetadata sourceMetadata,
           DataRecordMetadata targetMetadata)
             throws ComponentNotReadyException
        Description copied from interface: RecordNormalize
        Initializes normalize class/function. This method is called only once at the beginning of normalization process. Any object allocation/initialization should happen here.
        Specified by:
        init in interface RecordNormalize
        Parameters:
        parameters - Global graph parameters and parameters defined specially for the component which calls this transformation class
        sourceMetadata - Metadata describing source data records
        targetMetadata - Metadata describing target data record
        Returns:
        True if OK, otherwise False
        Throws:
        ComponentNotReadyException

      • countOnError

        public int countOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
               DataRecord source)
                 throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordNormalize
        Called only if RecordNormalize.count(DataRecord) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        countOnError in interface RecordNormalize
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused RecordNormalize.count(DataRecord) to fail
        source - Input record
        Returns:
        Number of output records which will be create from specified input record
        Throws:
        TransformException

      • transformOnError

        public int transformOnError(java.lang.Exception exception,
                   DataRecord source,
                   DataRecord target,
                   int idx)
                     throws TransformException
        Description copied from interface: RecordNormalize
        Called only if RecordNormalize.transform(DataRecord, DataRecord, int) throws an exception.
        Specified by:
        transformOnError in interface RecordNormalize
        Parameters:
        exception - an exception that caused RecordNormalize.transform(DataRecord, DataRecord, int) to fail
        source - Input record
        target - Output records
        idx - Sequential number of output record (starting from 0)
        Returns:
        < -1 -- fatal error / user defined -1 -- error / skip record >= 0 -- OK
        Throws:
        TransformException
